page.title: 18SCHOOL IN THE PAST DUNLOP
page.content: MRS.GLENNIE IS ONE OF DUNLOP'S SENIOR CITIZENS.SHE HAS LIVED IN DUNLOP FOR 66 YEARS.WHEN MRS.GLENNIE WAS YOUNG SHE CAME TO DUNLOP SCHOOL.SHE HAD TO WALK 2 MILES EVERY DAY TO AND FROM SCHOOL.AS MANY CHILDREN LIVED IN THE COUNTRY_SIDE IT TOOK LONGER FOR THEM TO WALK TO SCHOOL SO SCHOOL STARTED AT TEN PAST NINE.THERE WERE FOUR TEACHERS THE WORK THEY DID AT SCHOOL WAS MAINLY GRAMMAR AND SUMS.AT SCHOOL THERE WEREN'T ANY SCHOOL DINNERS OR MILK.YOU WERE FORCED TO WRITE WITH YOUR RIGHT HAND IF YOU DIDN'T YOU GOT THE{STRAP. THE PLAYGROUND WAS DIVIDED INTO TWO SO THAT THERE WAS A PLACE FOR BOTH BOYS AND GIRLS TO PLAY.IN THOSE DAYS THERE WAS NO SUCH THING AS A SCHOOL OUTING. EVERY TIME MRS.GLENNIE VISITS SHE NOTICES THE SCHOOL IS A LOT BRIGHTER. {STRAP}A STRIP OF LEATHER USED TO STRIKE THE HAND WHEN NAUGHTY.
